txt.en: 'Hoom, you have returned. My thanks to you, little [placeholder]. Saruman will soon learn his lesson....'
Blackthorn has been roused by the discovery that Saruman is behind the corruption of the Black Huorns.
There are places to summon Huorns throughout the eaves of Fangorn, bordering the Broadacres.\n\nBlackthorn asked you to put the acorns in special places to summon the Huorns.
Huorn acorns can be found throughout the eaves of Fangorn, bordering the Broadacres.\n\nBlackthorn asked you to gather Huorn acorns to summon his Huorns with.

'Hoom, I need your help one more time, little [placeholder]. If my folk knew what has happened, ta-rum, I am certain they be as roused against Isengard as I am. But the Ents are few and spread too far.\n\n'I need to you gather my Huorns. Search the wood for acorns dropped by the Huorns, then place them at special places throughout the forest. This will tell the Huorns that I am in need.'
Blackthorn awaits your return in the eaves of Fangorn, bordering the Broadacres.\n\nYou should return to Blackthorn and let him know that you have done as he asked.
